timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,34 @@
+= Variable scope
+
+== Description
+
+Defines lifecycle of a variable
+
+== Possible scopes
+
+[cols="1,5", options="header"]
+|===
+
+|Name
+|Description
+
+|step
+|The scope is used within nested steps and discarded after the nested steps are executed.
+
+|scenario
+|Variable declared with the scenario scope is available in the rest of scenario after it's declared. Scenario scoped variables are discarded once the scenario is completed.
+
+|story
+|Variable declared with the story scope is available in the rest of story after it's declared. Story scoped variables are discarded once the story is completed.
+
+|next_batches
+|Variable declared with the next_batches scope is available in next batches. Next_batches scoped variable is not available in batch it's declared within.
+
+|global
+|Such variabes are declared only in `*.properties` files with `bdd.variables.global.` prefix and available in all stories. Attempt to save global scoped variable in stories leads to exception.
+
+|===
+
+== Notes

timeline.bodyText: Does it make sense to make scopes inside description bold?
